channel.title: Removing items
channel.description: :( I can't figure out how to remove items/objects from my source i have now... I mean like moving a thieving stall or something like that, I checked tutorials and nothing on it. And nothing on moving items, so i really need help:( Please tell me how to do this :D

item.title: Removing items
item.dc:creator: @Scarr Scarr
item.description:
@Scarr wrote:

[quote=“Zelda Knight, post:6, topic:225041”][quote author=Scarr link=topic=295814.msg2378779#msg2378779 date=1218487237]

In Client.java search for public void NewObjects.

there should be something like

 MakeGlobalObject(XCOORD, YCOORD, ID, FACE, 10); //name of object here

just look for the thieving stalls Id and you can change the X and Y coord to where you want it to be.

He already got help!!
Epic failure Much?

Kthnxbye

Hahaha, you’re quite funny, considering the fact I was posting my post comment before he was, so yeah, shut up wanna-be java programmer, you suck and people like you are plumb retarded, go fall in a ditch and die.
[/quote]

LAWL!
SMF tells you if someone posted before you submitted your post.
You could see he got help.
Try leaving when he already got help.

This “discussion” is over. Get on with your life. Arguing here is doing fuck all m8.[/quote]

Hence the day people will actually grow a brain…

Read full topic

item.title: Removing items
item.dc:creator: @Matrix_Pride Matrix Pride
item.description:
@Matrix_Pride wrote:

Go into Your Client.Java and search for

GlobalObject

It will look something like this

makeGlobalObject(2795, 3165, 4462, 0, 10);//Training thief tables

2795 = X coord
3165 = Y coord
4462 = ItemID
0 = Direction facing
10 = Objects, DONT CHANGE THIS
// = Description

Read full topic
